10.64.text:
The President My fellow
Americans, I'm joining you

13.08.text: today from the deck of what will be our nation's newest

16.05.text:
aircraft carrier, the soon
to be commissioned,

20.89.text:
And as you can see, I'm
wearing a jacket and a hat

26.19.text:
I'm not really used to it,
but it feels awfully good.

28.96.text:
I'm very proud
of it actually.

31.10.text:
Our carriers are the
centerpiece of American

33.63.text: military might, projecting power, and our totally

39.74.text:
This beautiful new warship
represents the future

43.14.text:
of naval aviation, and she will
serve as a cornerstone

47.48.text:
of our national defense for
decades and decades to come.

51.18.text:
A famous aviator once wrote
that, "To build a truly

55.69.text:
great ship, we shouldn't
begin by gathering wood,

62.20.text:
But instead, by awakening
within the people a desire

67.03.text:
for the vast and
endless sea."

70.80.text:
In the same way, we must
continue to renew the

74.87.text:
American spirit in order to
rebuild our country,

80.38.text:
On Tuesday, before a joint
session to Congress, I laid

85.29.text:
out a version -- I hope you
all watched, for how

91.79.text:
My vision includes the
elimination of the defense

95.70.text:
sequester, which has imposed
steep cuts on our military.

100.50.text:
We must give our sailors,
soldiers, Airmen, Marines,

104.50.text:
and Coast Guardsmen the
tools, equipment, resources,

107.74.text:
and training they need to
get the job done and get it

112.55.text:
done right, especially in
these very dangerous times.

118.55.text:
The active duty army has
been reduced by more than

121.52.text:
85,000 men since 2009, and
we have over 18,000 fewer

131.40.text:
Air Force, is the smallest
it's been since 1947, and

138.00.text:
their planes are, on
average, nearly 30 years old.

144.98.text:
Our Navy's fleet is the
smallest it's been since

148.88.text:
World War One, and
that's a long time ago.

152.49.text:
Front line Navy and Marine
strike fighter aircraft are

155.59.text:
more likely to be down for
maintenance

157.96.text: than to be in the sky.

159.89.text:
We cannot afford to
continue down this path.

163.30.text:
My budget will give
America's armed forces the

166.33.text:
resources they need to
achieve full and total

169.57.text:
military preparedness to
meet any and all global

174.24.text:
challenges, and
meet them, we will.

178.34.text:
Investing in the military
means investing in peace

182.08.text:
because the best way to
prevent war, as George

186.19.text:
Washington said, is
to be prepared for it.

190.59.text:
Most importantly, an
investment in the military

193.83.text:
is an investment in the
incredible men and women

196.86.text:
who serve our country
in uniform.

199.97.text:
They are the best of us,
they are the greatest force

203.27.text:
for peace and justice the
world has ever known, and we

206.81.text:
will support them every
single step of the way.

213.68.text:
Amazing opportunities
are unfolding before us.

216.62.text:
To strengthen our military,
to reboot our economy, and

221.32.text:
to bring back our jobs -- if
we all work together and put

225.56.text:
our country first, then
anything is possible.

229.20.text:
Let us seize this moment
and make the most of this

236.30.text:
May God bless the men and
women of our military, and

239.81.text:
may God bless the United
States of America,
